{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the condition that occurs when there is an imbalance between the supply and demand of oxygen in the heart muscle. Document [19] states that 'Ischemic heart disease (IHD) is a condition in which there is an inadequate supply of blood and oxygen to a portion of the myocardium; it typically occurs when there is an imbalance between myocardial oxygen supply and demand.' This suggests that the imbalance leads to ischemia, which can cause a myocardial infarction, also known as a heart attack.", "answer_choice": "D. Myocardial infarction"}
